alert.note: Alert for Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 10:46AM EDT until July 12 at 12:06PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Essex Junction affecting Chittenden County. For the Winooski River...including Moretown, Montpelier, Waterbury, Essex Junction...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Essex Junction. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding will continue to be widespread along the Winooski river from Jonesville to Lake Champlain until the level drops below 14 feet. Water will continue cover Route 2 from Bolton to Williston, and Route 117 from Richmond to Essex. Bridge Street in Richmond, North Williston Road in Williston and Essex, Poor Farm Road in South Burlington and Williston will remain flooded, and the Burlington Intervale will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of near 20 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 04/18/1982. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EDT.
